channel.title: Should British Police Have Guns?
channel.description: At the moment the normal british police officer does carry a gun and if a gun is needed then the armed response unit is called in, what i want to know is should all british police officers carry a gun. I'd be interested to hear from both British and Americans on this matter as i was wondering would more gunfights occur if police had guns like in America or would the rate of crime actually go down if the British police started using guns?

item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

^ At least they show decent statistics

The sad part is that only gun murders get the media attention. You very rarely hear about the kids who bash their parents skulls with a hammer, or any other tool you can buy from a store.

In the UK it seems like it is very hard to legally own a gun, so a majority of the officers would never have to deal with one. In most cases a taser would be enough to stun in an event the officer is threatened, and when there is a hostage situation you call in the armed response anyway.

Even if you had the money to fully train and outfit every officer, you just wouldn’t need it.
